poll_list.title: Community Greenlight Poll - renDOGE (RenVM Dogecoin) - February 15, 2021
Community Greenlight Poll - rETH (Rocket Pool Staked ETH) - April 19, 2021
Add rETH as a new Vault Type - June 13, 2022

content.content: Hi All! On behalf of the Golem team, I would like to submit our first application to MakerDAO!  Technical Specifications   What is the token contract address? 0x7DD9c5Cba05E151C895FDe1CF355C9A1D5DA6429 Where can the source code be viewed? Please provide links to the source code for all contracts providing functionality to the token, including, but not limited to, transfers, freezes, whitelists, blacklists, transaction approvals/rejections, authorizations, upgradability, etc. https://github.com/golemfactory/golem  Which token standard does your token comply with? ERC20  Does the token have any special mechanics for handling forks? This may include forks in the token app or in the underlying blockchain. It’s an ERC-20 token, and it does not need mechanics for handling forks  If yes, please provide a reference to more information on fork handling.   My token fits with the following Dai Credit System adapter:  GemJoin I will supply my own adapter contract. Input reference below. It’s an erc-20 token, should be compatible or we can supply an adapter based on the one that was created when GNT was proposed   Has the token passed formal verification? no  If yes:  Please describe the specification. Who composed the specification? Please provide a link to the result of the verification.     Upload audit report created by qualified research personnel. https://blog.golemproject.net/gnt-migration-audit-report/    Financial Specifications   Overview Questions   Please provide a short summary of your project. Golem Network is a marketplace for idle computing power. It enables providers and requestors of computing power to connect in a trustless peer-to-peer network enabling both application owners and individual users (“requestors”) to rent resources from other users’ (“providers”) machines. These resources can be used to complete tasks requiring any amount of computation time and capacity. Nowadays, centralized cloud providers are in control of these services, these platforms are constrained by closed networks, proprietary payment systems, and hard-coded provisioning operations. Golem proposes an open-source, decentralized and user controlled alternative. Please list the founding members. Founders were Piotr Janiuk, Aleksandra Skrzypczak, Julian Zawistowki. Current leadership team member are: Piotr Janiuk, Jakub	Kucharski, Maria Paula Fernandez, Grzegorz Nowakowski, Agniezka Stawowczyk What type of crypto asset is it (utility, work, governance, etc)? Utility If native crypto asset, which category (utility, work, governance, etc)? Utility What is the token’s usage in the project? How is the token utilized? The token GLM is a utility token used to access the Golem Network, through which you can pay other users within the Network for renting computations   Issuance - Bearer Assets   What was the date of the ICO? We held a crowdfunding in on November 11, 2016 and ended in 29 minutes. Total created 1.000.000.000 GNT What was the initial price and valuation? GLM was migrated from our previous token GNT on a ration 1:1. Creation Rate: The Creation Rate during Creation Period for each GNT was 0.001 ETH (i.e. 1000 GNT per 1 ETH). How much capital was raised (in USD and crypto terms)? Funds raised 820.000 ETH /  8M USD at the time What was the token distribution breakdown? Pool A of 82% of total GNT created, for ETH; Pool B of 12% of total GNT created to the Factory pursuant the Smart Contract; Pool C of 6% of total GNT created, to early contributors and team members Are any tokens on a vesting schedule? If so, what is that schedule? Describe any related vestiture limitations. No, our token has been in circulation in the market for four years  What are the circulating and total supply of the token? 100% of the tokens What is the wallet address of the treasury? 0x7da82C7AB4771ff031b66538D2fB9b0B047f6CF9 How much of the ICO raise was converted into fiat (described in both terms of that fiat currency and the amount of tokens? We still hold the majority of the raise https://etherscan.io/address/0x7da82c7ab4771ff031b66538d2fb9b0b047f6cf9  Were there any pre-ICO seed investors? Who and what were their respective allocations? no   Fundamentals   Please link to the whitepaper and/or pitch deck related to the token. whitepaper https://golem.network/crowdfunding/Golemwhitepaper.pdf  Please link to the most updated roadmap for your project. https://blog.golemproject.net/next-milestone/  How many employees and contractors does your project have? We currently have 33 people between employees and contractors What is the monthly burn rate? Golem is a private company and monthly burn rate is not open What is the strategy for treasury management? We liquidated a small part of the stash in 2017/ beginning of 2018. We have sufficient runway for at least two more years. The rest of the stash is held in ETH (include how much we have - its on etherscan) and our strategy is holding, which has worked quite well since we crowdfunded in 2016 _    Markets   Which exchanges is your token listed on?  Uniswap, Binance, Bittrex, Poloniex, Huobi, Bithumb, Upbit, Exodus, Coinswitch Kuber, Crypto.com, WazirX, CEX.IO, Bitso, Bitfinex, HitBTC, CoinEx, Cointree, Gate.io, Upbit Indonesia  Does your token have custodial support? Where/with whom? Please provide a copy of the custodial agreement if available. no   Community   Please link your email, Telegram, subreddit, Discord, Twitter, Medium. email: [email protected], Subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/GolemProject/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/golemproject Telegram: https://t.me/GolemProject Medium https://medium.com/@golemproject blog: https://blog.golemproject.net/  What is the website of your project? https://golem.network/    Legal Specifications    Who is the token issuer (if any)? Golem Factory GmbH   Do you have legal representation related (1) to the issuance of the token, (2) regulatory requirements regarding the token, or (3) otherwise? If so, whom? We have legal opinions from LINDGREN, LINDGREN, OEHM & YOU, LLP and from MME Legal Ltd   What is the regulatory status of the token? Please provide relevant documentation (e.g., legal opinions, prospectuses, public disclosures, filing documents, etc.). download and upload these materials   Are there any rights associated with the token that do not follow from its technical implementation or technical ramifications of the system in which the token is used? If so, what are they? How are they enforced? Please provide documentation memorializing these rights. no, we have been on mainnet since 2018 and the token is in use. we’ve migrated now, but about to launch the new mainnet with the new token.   In what jurisdiction(s) was the token issued?? Please provide all filings and public documents related to the token’s issuance. Swiss Law   Was the token issued as part of a regulatory process (e.g., securities offering)? If so, under which law, rule and/or regulation was the token issued? Please provide all documents related to this regulatory issuance process (to the extent not already provided in response to the above). no   Was the token issued as part of the fundraising process for your project? If yes, who are the investors and how much equity do they respectively hold? yes. we crowdfunded so no equity   Please describe the corporate and legal structure of the project/system/product in which the token is used. Golem Factory GmbH
One of the oldest and trustees tokens with real use case and strong team. Support it.

Collateral Engineering Services (CES) is following up with Greenlit collateral applications that have been open for some time. I want to notify you of some changes we have made in the past month. If you are interested in continuing the collateral onboarding process, we ask that you update your application using the most current template, MIPs Portal. Note the current recommended guidelines for onchain collateral, MIP6 Recommended Guideline Metrics for Onchain Collateral Onboarding. Please reply within a week as to your intention. If we do not hear back from you, your collateral application will be marked as inactive and you will need to reapply. To reapply, please start with a new MIP6 application. The collateral onboarding process is documented here, https://collateral.makerdao.com/ Thanks GLM!

MIP6 Collateral Application - rETH 1. Who is the interested party for this collateral application?  Rocket Pool Pty Ltd. David Rugendyke | Project Founder, CTO  2. Provide a brief high-level overview of the project, with a focus on the applying collateral token.  Rocket Pool is an Ethereum 2.0 Proof of Stake infrastructure service. rETH is a redemption token representing staked ETH. Without a stake pool service, only wealthy network participants who meet the 32ETH threshold are rewarded for validating transactions. Rocket Pool democratizes participation in network validation by providing a service which lowers the wealth threshold. Abstracting staked ETH as rETH participants are able to retain commodity properties of their stake (transfer of ownership). ‘Our Vision’ Blog Post  3. Provide a brief history of the project.  2017 - Rocket Pool proof of concept based on the specifications released for Casper in the Mauve paper by Vitalik Buterin. Today there is a great team working on Rocket Pool passionately alongside a fantastic community. Both have helped Rocket Pool run two public betas with over 50,000 ETH (testnet) staked and hundreds of users participating over the last 1–2 years. With the transition to PoS on the horizon, Rocket Pool propounds Ethereum core values, advancing decentralized staking.  4. Link the whitepaper, documentation portals, and source code for the system(s) that interact with the proposed collateral, and all relevant Ethereum addresses. If the system is complex, schematic(s) are especially appreciated.  Website - rocketpool.net Whitepaper GitHub Repository FAQ  5. Link any available audits of the project. Both procedural and smart contract focused audits.   EDDC - Consensys Diligence Sigma Prime Trail of Bits  These are the audits and then this has fairly accurate liquidity numbers - https://forum.abracadabra.money/t/rfc-adding-a-reth-cauldron-to-abracadabra-lending-markets/1862 6. Link to any active communities relating to your project.  Rocket Pool Governance Forum  Discord - Public discussion group  Blog - Announcements / FAQ / Public disclosures. Twitter Node Operators Guide  7. How is the applying collateral type currently used?  rETH is used as a commodity by people wishing to passively provide stake in the Ethereum network. rETH represents a claim to ETH deposits and staking rewards in the Rocket Pool protocol.  8. Does one organization bear legal responsibility for the collateral? What jurisdiction does that organization reside in?  Brisbane, Queensland (QLD)  9. Where does exchange for the asset occur?  Uniswap, Balancer It is intended that rETH will be able to be exchanged wherever ETH is exchanged.  Liquidity (End of year 2021) rETH 37,719 Total supply $135m Market capitalization Snapshot of rETH liquidity positions:  Uniswap: $6.12m total liquidity with 86 ETH (Uniswap Info) Balancer: $680k total liquidity with 104 ETH (Balancer) Rocket Pool deposit pool: $5.6m liquidity with 1,596 ETH   The Rocket Pool deposit pool is funds waiting to be matched with node operators, it provides liquidity for those wanting to exit rETH positions and has the benefit of no trade slippage. L2 positions:  Uniswap Arbitrum - $1.99m total liquidity with 101 ETH  Uniswap Optimism - $399k total liquidity with 66.99 WETH  Uniswap Polygon - TBC but we are are expecting 200k liquidity to be included in the next couple of days
Would love to see this being brought forward - rETH is the most decentralized liquid staking derivative.

rETH is an important upgrade to the security and decentralization of Ethereum as a whole, and a Maker integration has a lot of possibilities. For example, it would be neat to use rETH with Maker to create a self-repaying loan – like Alchemix, but simpler. I believe this was submitted when Rocket Pool wasn’t live yet, but it’s live and working perfectly on mainnet now.
A Maker integration would pose benefits to users of all of DeFi and allow things such as self-paying loans. I vote in favor of supercharging DeFi with a decentralized yield bearing derivative of ETH.
I strongly support this integration!
Absolutely agree, I hope RETH is re-prioritized as collateral now that it’s fully in the wild.
Gotta happen. rEth has the potential to be used across DeFi more than any other ERC20
I 100% support this initiative, Rocket Pool is rock solid and this integration would benefit Maker.
100% support ! love the Rocket pool community , and love rETH , better for the whole  ether ecosystem
Long time lurker, first time getting involved with discussions - rETH is the main asset I’m waiting for DAI to be backed by due to more long-term DeFi activity, given its value accrual tokenomics.
So… who’s paying the bribes to come post on the forum lol? So many first time posters.
No bribes, passion! When this proposal was originally put forward - reth was in testnet now it is live and so people are hoping to use it in DeFi as collateral.

Exactly what AmethystWizard said. We’ve been waiting for a long time for the project to launch, now we would like to use reth in defi. Could also be this article that brought people. If you think people support Rocket Pool because of bribes, you might want to read about what the project brings to the table.

hey @AmethystWizard , I’m looking over your initial post, and (rightfully so) a lot has changed since then. The original audit link is quite outdated and contains lorem ipsum text, so just a heads up if you (or any Rocketpool dev/community member) believe reaching out to Ethddc to update it is a good idea. Going over Rocketpool’s website I can see other, more technical audits have been released and I’m currently going through them but I thought it might be a good idea for you to update your initial post if possible, just to make sure we’re all on the same page.
Looks good

@AmethystWizard If you need any help on getting this proposal up to speed in the ways that @kaue outlined I would be happy to lend a hand where I can. Would really love to see rETH get added as collateral as soon as possible!

My initial comment was based on the wrong token; another rETH from Stafi. Back to the correct rETH from Rocketpool, with which I also have some concerns;  At current supply of 29k tokens, which brings us to $120m market cap, we will likely not be able to issue a large amount of debt, assuming we don’t want to hold a considerable amount of total supply. This can lead to the vault type being unprofitable due to costs related to maintenance. To my knowledge the only market is Uni v3 with $4.5m rETH liquidity and $5.38m rETH/ETH pair liquidity. There is much more rETH (1100) than ETH (230) in the pool, which results in a situation where you can only sell 230 rETH. Based on this situation the debt ceiling would need to be below 1m dai.  Until market liquidity is significantly increased I don’t think it’s reasonable to add rETH as collateral.
We strongly need this. rETH will make a significant contribution to the growth of ETH ecosystem.

Hello  In addition to the technical assessment Kauê spoke about, the Risk CU published a response to the MIP that needs to be addressed. I realize the importance of the ETH ecosystem and I am a supporter of the innovation happening with staking solutions. For the Maker protocol, there are specific requirements and guidelines we need to meet before onboarding a collateral type. Yes, the past was a little different and now, we’re committed to doing a better job of communicating the guidelines upfront like market cap, liquidity, and costs like Oracles. And, there is always the strategic consideration that comes into play when onboarding collateral. Others can debate and decide on whether Maker is in the position to drive rETH like WBTC and stETH. For me, the questions being presented need solid answers before we can move forward.

Hi @rema, I am on the Rocket Pool core team, great to be working with you. Depth and breath of liquidity for rETH is now a key focus for the core team and community. rETH is now at 37,719 supply and a market cap of $135m. Here is a snapshot of our rETH liquidity positions:  Uniswap: $6.12m total liquidity with 86 ETH (Uniswap Info) Balancer: $680k total liquidity with 104 ETH (Balancer) Rocket Pool deposit pool: $5.6m liquidity with 1,596 ETH   The Rocket Pool deposit pool is funds waiting to be matched with node operators, it provides liquidity for those wanting to exit rETH positions. It has been quite consistently above 1k ETH for the last 4 weeks. Long-term we believe this trend (high rETH demand vs node operator supply) will continue, providing a significant source of liquidity. The Rocket Pool deposit pool also has the benefit of no trade slippage. For reference, in case it is relevant I have included our L2 positions here:  Uniswap Arbitrum - $1.99m total liquidity with 101 ETH  Uniswap Optimism - $399k total liquidity with 66.99 WETH  Uniswap Polygon - TBC but we are are expecting 200k liquidity to be included in the next couple of days  Is our current level of liquidity acceptable? - particularly if we are able to include the Rocket Pool deposit pool. Or, if not, would you mind providing us with a target you would be comfortable with? FYI @monkey.irish
darrenlangley:  FYI @monkey.irish   Thank you!

Hey @darrenlangley, Thank you for providing these details! In the case where liquidity in the Rocket Pool deposit pool can be used without restrictions - waiting time, quantity vise and that anyone is able to use it - the pool can be considered equal to any other permissionless on-chain liquidity sources like AMM pools. We just want to be sure that rETH used as collateral can be sold in a timely manner without a large price impact. L2 & sidechain liquidity will be much more relevant once MCD is deployed on them, but also currently that liquidity is not completely irrelevant, but we generally do not consider it directly, because it can not be used in flash loan transactions, and there can be a time delay when withdrawing assets back to L1. As a rule of thumb, we aim for the asset to provide 20-30m dai or more. Now obviously, there are assets currently in the protocol which have much less than that, but at the time of onboarding, it was expected that demand would be larger as it actually turned out to be and conditions were different. As a consequence we had to offboard various assets which many consider as blue chips in the space, such as AAVE, COMP, ZRX, BAT, BAL, which generally have $1b+ market caps. Even if we assume, that half of current rETH would be used as collateral (which is considered a maximum exposure we want to have towards one specific asset) with a healthy debt weighted collateral ratio of 250% (current state of Lido stETH vaults), we would come to 27m dai issued. This would be acceptable, but it is very unlikely that half of all rETH would be used in Maker. Assuming the above, this means we potentially have to liquidate more than 10k+ tokens in the case of a large market crash. Such an event would produce large price slippage on ETH itself, due to all the unwinding and liquidations in various lending protocols, so the rETH/ETH slippage should be as small as possible and is added on top of the ETH slippage. That said, it is fair to say that current liquidity is not sufficient, and considering that we are dealing with ETH, the rETH/ETH should really be minimal. Specific number for liquidity is relative to various conditions in the markets, Maker system, Ethereum in general and will change during time. For example, if transacting on Ethereum becomes much cheaper than it is today, we would have no problems with much lower issued debt from collaterals. Because of this I don’t want to state a specific number which can be used as a condition, before such guidelines are officially issued by MakerDAO, but based on the hypothetical example above and current conditions, we (risk CU) would likely be comfortable with 10k+ ETH or equivalent liquidity to start with the asset, with the assumption that the ecosystem will grow and liquidity increases over time.

Hi @rema, Thank you for the reply - it gives us a good indication of ecosystem liquidity requirements. We will devise a strategy accordingly so that we can ideally meet those requirements in the medium term. Thank you for guiding us through this and I hope we can speak again soon.
I’ve updated the original post with the additional audits and TVL / Liquidity info for end of year 2021.

I strongly support the onboarding of rETH as collateral. It is the only decentralized liquid staking token of ETH and is the fastest growing. It is also the oldest ETH staking project and it’s team is extremely Ethereum aligned. I understand the limited liquidity may lead to some hesitancy in supporting rETH at this time, but it is rapidly growing. If we are slow with implementation, by the time they have higher liquidity that it minimizes concerns, rETH holders will likely find have found homes in on other DeFi protocols and be difficult to re-capture. I believe for a high quality, fully decentralized, ETH yield bearing asset such as rETH, it is important for MakerDAO to be more risk tolerant and onboard it ASAP.
It seems to me that this protocol in terms of numbers and demand is a bit gray. I agree, however, on the decentralization factor and all the benefits it can be for Maker.

Hi @rema, Please find an update on the rETH. rETH is now at 85,599 supply and a market cap of $246m. Our L1 liquidity across Uniswap, Balancer, Curve, and Bancor totals: ~26,582 rETH liquidity ~6,170 ETH liquidity Here are our rETH liquidity positions: Rocket Pool deposit pool: 2,000 ETH Curve: rETH: 22,067, wstETH: 6,511 (Curve) Balancer: rETH: 3,071, ETH: 3,384 (Balancer ) Uniswap: rETH: 1120, ETH: 720K (Uniswap Info ) Bancor: rETH: 25 Please let me know if you have any other questions.

Saw a comment in the polling about not wanting to spread CU resources too thin by onboarding rETH. I want to point out that on-chain collateral onboarding is one of our most streamlined processes from a technical perspective and probably offers the most bang-for-buck from technical CU’s provided we can get enough borrower liquidity to make it worthwhile from an oracle cost perspective. PECU has built out the toolkit to add new collaterals quickly and relatively painlessly, and we’ve been working with CES to offboard most of the procedure from our team. I wouldn’t worry about technical costs here provided the onboarding makes sense in terms of market risk.

brianmcmichael:  I wouldn’t worry about technical costs here provided the onboarding makes sense in terms of market risk.   For 3F Delegate its more about the size of the collateral type, opportunity cost, market risk (spillover effect), and yea–the 225 basis pts for a 5M DC is the type of collateral that we have supported in the past, and has let us down. Most haven’t scale. Hence, we are taking the other side of this trade here–but welcome MKR token owners and Delegates to do what they believe is best for MakerDAO. Otherwise, we had a good conversation with Derek at Consensus and it was good to hear that your team has streamlined the onboarding process and are collaborating with CES to take on the heavy lifting of the process. Looking forward to an automate onboarding process.

Got a request to explain my No decision. Once again, unless there’s a clear commitment to deploy certain amount to make this vault profitable, it’s likely that the cost will be higher than the fee considering its small marketcap.

We like Rocketpool and rETH, but right now they won’t contribute significant revenue to the protocol and resources are better spent elsewhere. This could mean that rETH might be voted in at a later time.

Add rETH as a new Vault Type - June 13, 2022 We have voted yes to the recent proposal with details below from our Maker Protocol Lead @Jf123. YES- We believe that Rocket Pool’s staking services are on par with that of Lido’s. Despite current market conditions, we expect rETH to meet the initial, wanted threshold of DAI generated and grow in liquidity as time progresses. However, we are not opposed to voting in rETH later as outlined by @teemulau.

1. Who is the interested party for this collateral application? MakerDAO community in conjunction with the Dogecoin community.  2. Provide a brief high-level overview of the project, with a focus on the applying collateral token. renDOGE is a tokenized representation of DOGE on the Ethereum blockchain. It is an ERC20, and backed 1:1 with real DOGE locked in RenVM, a decentralized custodian. It is redeemable at any time for real DOGE. RenVM is a byzantine fault-tolerant protocol that provides ECDSA threshold key generation and signing via sMPC. What makes RenVM unique is that it does all key management and rotation using its sMPC based protocol that the team has pioneered. The state, inputs, and outputs of all programs that RenVM runs (e.g. ECDSA private keys) are kept hidden from everyone, including the Darknodes that power it. This allows RenVM to securely manage (ECDSA) private keys of different assets, making it possible to mint or burn tokenized representations of these assets on external blockchains in a trustless, permissionless, and decentralized manner.  3. Provide a brief history of the project.  Q1 2018 - Decentralized Darkpools Ren (Republic Protocol at the time) sold out a $35mm ICO. The original mandate was to build darkpools for digital assets - a way to prevent front-running and price slippage by trading large amounts in a private, decentralized manner. This idea placed the project in the ‘interface’ layer of the stack. Rather than just building a single darkpool,  the intention was to provide infrastructure for third parties to build multiple dark pools, pooling liquidity and providing a better end-user experience. RenEx and SwapperD were built and delivered (Q4 2018)  Q1 2019 - Republic Protocol Evolves to Ren Ren team realizes that what they have built applies to much more than Darkpools, pivots down the stack to an ‘interoperability (+ privacy) protocol’ and RenVM is born. Rather than operating a single darkpool, or allowing multiple dark pools to build and connect, the protocol will now provide key interoperability infrastructure for DEXs, OTC desks, loan & leverage platforms, liquidity pools, NFTs, dApps, etc.  Q3 2019 - Formal RenVM Testnet: August 2019 - Present  This is still utilized to test features prior to implementation on Mainnet. The RenVM Mainnet Rollout Plan articulates the steps for testing and gradual decentralization of the protocol. Follows the recommendation of Progressive Decentralization from Andreessen Horowitz. (Published September 2019)  Q4 2019 - RenVM Chaosnet | RenVM Mainnet Unaudited  Formal RenVM Chaosnet: November 2019 - Present The sole purpose of this was to put RenVM Mainnet through as many stress tests as possible prior to Mainnet release. The Ren team believes this prudent approach (a 6 month testing period) to RenVM’s security (in addition to formal verification from security auditors) has been crucial for its robustness and subsequent success. Chaosnet is still utilized to test features prior to implementation on Mainnet. (Published November 2019)  Q2 2020 - RenVM Mainnet | Subzero  RenVM Mainnet is released May 27th, 2020. RenVM Mainnet Dashboard (Network Stats)  Q3 2020 - Open-Sourcing RZL MPC  One of the most important technical goals for the project is getting to a stage where the team is comfortable open-sourcing the implementation of the RZL MPC algorithm. Over the last month, the Ren dev team has begun decoupling the MPC implementation from the rest of the codebase, making it easier to iterate, test, and understand. As a part of this, they have been implementing new optimizations, building multiple versions of some parts of the codebase to gain even more confidence in its correctness, and moving to a new design centered around easy-to-understand state machines. All of this comes together to make a codebase that is simpler, safer, faster, and easier for everyone to test/review/audit. An overview of this logic, can be found here. The Ren team has engaged with several auditing teams to review these changes, and once they are completed, will be ready to make the codebase available under the GNU GPL v3 license. This is planned for release by the end of Q3 2020, depending on the timeframes of these audits.  4. Link the whitepaper, documentation portals, and source code for the system(s) that interact with the proposed collateral, and all relevant Ethereum addresses. If the system is complex, schematic(s) are especially appreciated. RenVM 101 RenVM Technical Overview | Wiki RZL sMPC Whitepaper PDF Fees & Economics Safety and Liveness Github Developer Documentation RenVM Mainnet Dashboard (Network Stats) Ren Resource Center renDOGE ERC20 Contract Index  5. Link any available audits of the project. Both procedural and smart contract focused audits. RenVM Audit Homepage Smart Contracts by ChainSecurity, November 2019 Hyperdrive by ChainSecurity, May 2020 RZL MPC by Consensys Diligence May 2020  6. Link to any active communities relating to your project. Telegram Twitter Reddit Medium  7. How is the applying collateral type currently used? renDOGE is a one for one representation of DOGE on Ethereum via RenVM. As an ERC20, it is/can be utilized in a variety of capacities within the DeFi ecosystem; lending, leveraging, trading, etc.  8. Does one organization bear legal responsibility for the collateral? What jurisdiction does that organization reside in? No, decentralized protocol  9. Where does exchange for the asset occur? Individuals can acquire renDOGE by minting it with real DOGE via OpenDAO. The same minting process can be achieved on other 3rd party platforms who choose to integrate RenVM (as its SDKs are permissionless). Further, renDOGE is an ERC20 and can be found throughout the DeFi AMM ecosystem.  10. Has your project obtained any legal opinions or memoranda regarding the regulatory standing of the token or an explanation of the same from the perspective of any jurisdiction? If so, those materials should be provided for community review. N/A  11. Describe whether there are any regulatory registrations for the token and provide related documentation (including an explanation of any past or existing interactions with any regulatory authorities, regardless of jurisdiction), if applicable. N/A  12. List any possible oracle data sources for the proposed Collateral type. Dogecoin has been in existence for seven years, hence it is listed on many centralized exchanges already supported by setzer including Binance, OKEx & Karken. Note: RenVM (and its ERC20 based assets) itself does not utilize oracles, renDOGE is a 1:1 peg to DOGE.  13. List any parties interested in taking part in liquidations for the proposed Collateral type. N/A
You actually might be on to something here
Nothing against REN, but does Maker really want a meme coin that’s easily manipulated such as DOGE backing dai?

beepidibop:  Nothing against REN, but does Maker really want a meme coin that’s easily manipulated such as DOGE backing dai?   MakerDAO ultimately should have ALL collaterals. The problem is that embarking new collaterals is costly (risks evaluations, oracles, smart-contracts, etc), so we need to prioritise the choices. But, in principle, if they bring value (fees), why not? Regarding the “manipulated” (and therefore risky): this can be handled by the several parameters of a collateral (SF, max col. ratio, etc). Example: If Dogecoin holders are willing to pay 25% SF (just a crazy example) and accept a max col. ratio of 250% (another crazy example), then why not?

iammeeoh:  Example: If Dogecoin holders are willing to pay 25% SF (just a crazy example) and accept a max col. ratio of 250% (another crazy example), then why not?   Yup, at those high SF rates you also start leaning towards  “predatory lending” territory in the U.S.—some States might cap it—like in Colorado—If there’s no agreement to the terms of the loan, it’s capped at 8%. Not sure if a smart contract is admissible as an “agreement” in the state of Colorado, and others. But I’m not an attorney, nor do I ever wish to be one.

flipflopflapdelegate:  Yup, at those high SF rates you also start leaning towards “predatory lending” territory in the U.S.—some States might cap it—like in Colorado—If there’s no agreement to the terms of the loan, it’s capped at 8%. iammeeoh:  We are currently charging 50% on USDC-B   Ya–this Vault in only intended for Emergency usage, only. But Totally–it’s opaque.

The renDOGE MIP6 greenlight poll has concluded, final result: No (Defer) 24,525.74 MKR Voting (69.20%) Yes (Greenlight) 10,712.08 MKR Voting (30.22%) Abstain 204.54 MKR Voting (0.58%) This application is deferred, likely due to the very inequitable distribution of DOGE coin.
